If you're setting up a Ledger device for the first time or need to find specific resources, you should visit the official Ledger start page at ledger.com/start. Here’s what you can expect and how to proceed:

1. Visit the Ledger Start Page

  • Go to ledger.com/start: This page serves as the main hub for setting up your Ledger hardware wallet.

2. Select Your Device

  • Choose Your Model: You'll be prompted to select your Ledger device model (Ledger Nano S, Ledger Nano X, or Ledger Nano S Plus).

3. Download Ledger Live

  • Install Ledger Live: The page will guide you to download Ledger Live, the official software for managing your crypto assets with your Ledger device. Follow the prompts to download and install Ledger Live for your operating system (Windows, macOS, or Linux).

4. Set Up Your Ledger Device

  • Connect Your Device: Once you have Ledger Live installed, connect your Ledger device to your computer using the provided USB cable.
  • Initialize Your Device: Follow the instructions in Ledger Live to initialize your device. This will include:
    • Choosing a PIN: Select a secure PIN code that you will use to unlock your device.
    • Writing Down Your Recovery Phrase: You’ll be given a 24-word recovery phrase. Write this down on the provided recovery sheet and store it securely. This phrase is crucial for recovering your wallet if your device is lost or damaged.

5. Install Apps on Your Ledger Device

  • Manage Cryptocurrencies: Using the "Manager" tab in Ledger Live, you can install apps for the specific cryptocurrencies you want to manage on your Ledger device.

6. Add Accounts

  • Set Up Accounts: After installing the necessary apps, you can add accounts for your cryptocurrencies within Ledger Live. This allows you to view balances, send/receive funds, and more.

7. Start Using Ledger Live

  • Manage Your Portfolio: Once everything is set up, you can use Ledger Live to manage your portfolio, check your balance, make transactions, and access additional features like staking or swapping cryptocurrencies.

Security Tips

  • Secure Your Recovery Phrase: Your 24-word recovery phrase is the key to your wallet. Never share it with anyone, and keep it stored securely offline.
  • Beware of Phishing: Only download Ledger Live and access Ledger services through the official Ledger website to avoid phishing scams.
  • Keep Firmware Updated: Regularly update your Ledger device’s firmware and Ledger Live software to ensure you have the latest security features.
